definition: to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: The dog barked and gave him a fright.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗的吠叫使他吓了一跳。

sentences.english: A black dog ran towards him and snarled.
sentences.chinese: 一只黑狗向他冲过来，冲他吠叫。

sentences.english: Our dog, Rex, used to sit outside our front gate and bark.
sentences.chinese: 的狗雷克斯常蹲在大门外吠叫。

sentences.english: I told the dog to be quiet, but it ignored me and kept barking.
sentences.chinese: 我叫那只豿安静下来，但是它不理我，继续吠叫。

sentences.english: The dog gave several fierce barks.
And every time, Callie barks at it.
sentences.chinese: 而每次佳丽都会对着门吠叫。

sentences.english: The dog threw his head back and barked sharply.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗把头向后一扬，发出刺耳的吠叫。

sentences.english: The hounds were baying at the box.
The basenji is the only type of dog that doesn't bark.
sentences.chinese: 巴辛吉犬是唯一不会吠叫的狗。

sentences.english: Patrasche barked at the door, but it was useless.
sentences.chinese: 帕特拉斯基对着门吠叫，但没有用。

sentences.english: She never barked or tried to get away.
sentences.chinese: 她从来不会大声吠叫或者跑掉。

sentences.english: The dog indicates his feelings by barking or wagging his tail.
sentences.chinese: 狗借助吠叫或摇尾来表示自己的情感。

sentences.english: Pessimistic dogs appear to be more prone to engage in unwanted behaviors, such as barking and destruction.
sentences.chinese: 悲观的狗更易做出不可爱的行为，如吠叫和破坏。

sentences.english: There are many different types of barks.
sentences.chinese: 有许多不同种类的吠叫。

sentences.english: The dog barked at him loudly whenever he saw him.
sentences.chinese: 黑狗每次看到小锡士兵，就对他大声地吠叫。

sentences.english: The dog barked at the jogger.
